direction.raw_text: - OCTOBER 22, 1998" Claire stares at the familiar face, then shakily hits PRINT. LATER Claire is staring down at the girl's face on the print out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on phone) ...she was practically a townie.  Grew up in Bradford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she was never found?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on phone) Nah.  She was a live wire.  Had this old Mustang Fastback.  It's gone too.  Most of her friends think she's tooling around Mexico somewhere.  Police downgraded her to a runaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Mr... She glances at the byline on the back of the newspaper photo. INSERT "by Neil McCann"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...McCann. She hangs up. INT.  NORMAN'S STUDY - NIGHT Norman is unpacking NOTES and CHEMICALS from his LEATHER BAG. Claire walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember this? She places the printout on his desk.  He takes a long look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this that girl from last year? Claire nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know her? Norman looks again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I may have seen her on campus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not personally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (beat) I'm afraid to ask what this is about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (solemnly) It's her.  This is the woman who I've seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  The ghost. Norman leaves the hung frame and walks over to a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it was Mrs. Feur, but it's not...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly overlapping) Stop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I'm positive this time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (overlapping) ...Please stop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Madison Fra--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Claire falls silent, Norman turns from the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calmly) Claire, I've tried to be there.  I know you're going through something that I can't understand...but it's enough. Claire looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to go see someone?  Together? Should we call Dr. Drayton? She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then what?  Claire, what?  Tell me what I can do. Long pause.  Claire looks up, then timidly holds out the printout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's her. Norman's jaw tightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to make you angry.  But she's here.  And I don't know why... He silently walks out of the room.  Claire stares down at the face in the photo. EXT.  MADISON FRANK'S HOUSE - DAY Claire parks in front of a small, clapboard house in a neighborhood that is decidedly less upscale than her own. She gets out and tentatively walks up to the tiny porch. EXT.  PORCH - DAY Claire rings the bell.  A DRAWN LOOKING WOMAN in her early fifties answers the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Frank?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to talk to you about Madison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know where she is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please leave me alone. She starts to close the door.  Claire leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my friend. The woman stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was.  We were...acquainted.  I've been away for awhile.  When I came back... She studies Claire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She never mentioned you. Claire doesn't know what to say to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then again, she didn't say much about her college friends. She gives Claire the once over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm watchin' my shows. She motions Claire in. INT.  LIVING ROOM - DAY Claire sits on a couch in the cramped living room.  Mrs. Frank serves up a mug of coffee.  A soap plays silently on an old 19" RCA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just plain old coffee.  None of that mocha nonsense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine. She sizes Claire up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look a little old for a student.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not.  We...we met at a party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds about right.  Never understood how a girl that wild got all A's.  Sure didn't get it from me.  They wanted to put her in a special school for the gifted when she was young.  Maddie wouldn't hear about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She never mentioned her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well she wouldn't.  He left when she was twelve.  Never spoke about him after that. There's a silence.  Mrs. Frank stares at the TV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't need the sound.  You can pretty much tell what's happening by the faces.  Turn it up sometimes, though.  Feels like someone's here. Claire doesn't know what to say.  Mrs. Frank turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like that.  Doesn't seem real.  No note.  Nothing. (beat) Cops say she'll be back.  I just wanna know what happened. Claire stares at this tough, tragic woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna see her room? Claire nods. INT.  MADISON'S ROOM - DAY Claire enters the room.  Her face freezes. ANGLE SEVERAL POSTERS FOR ALTERNATIVE AND METAL BANDS, side by side with ACADEMIC PLAQUES AND AWARDS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Full scholarships.  Princeton too.  She wanted to stay close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must have been very proud. She nods.  Claire moves along looking at pictures.  Some with different men, others with rough looking friends.  Claire stops at a picture tucked into a mirror. INSERT Madison singing at a recital of some kind.  She's lovely, with striking GREEN EYES.  Around her neck is a distinctive SILVER NECKLACE, with a perfectly wrought, SILVER ROSEBUD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such a pretty voice.  Surprised she didn't major in music. (beat) That's the last picture. A phone rings in the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S'cuse me. Claire's eye is pulled past the picture into the mirror, the reflection of something pinned to the edge of a bulletin board.  She turns and moves over to: A SHORT BLOND BRAID.  She reaches out to touch it.  Claire hears footsteps.  Mrs. Frank leans back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're calling me in to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be going anyway. EXT.  PORCH - DAY Mrs. Frank walks Claire out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'hear anything you'll let me know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. Claire walks to her car.  She turns and calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was her major?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biology.  She wanted to be a doctor. Claire stands, frozen, as Mrs. Frank disappears into the little house. INT.  BATHROOM - NIGHT Claire shuts the blinds, then places the large candle on the floor, then places the MISSING GIRL PRINTOUT at the base of the candle.  On top if it, she places THE BRAID. Then Claire lights the candle, puts the braid on the picture, and hunches over it, whispering intensely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to know the truth. She waits a beat.  Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madison, please...help me. Nothing happens.  She looks around at the seance props. She stands and places her hands on the sink.  She glances at herself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I doing? Suddenly, her head droops over, she shudders softly.  When she looks back into the mirror, her eyes are a DEEP GREEN. She hears the front door open downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...Anybody home?! A strange smile creeps across her face. INT.  CLAIRE'S HOUSE - NIGHT POV - Gliding down the stairs and into... INT.  KITCHEN - NIGHT The refrigerator door is open.  Norman is leaning over.  Only his ass protrudes. REVERSE Norman closes the refrigerator door and sees Claire standing before him, stripped down to a skirt and slip top.  There's a different physicality to her movements...a different rhythm to her speech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Dr. Spencer. Norman smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Spencer. She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forbidden fruit... She takes the apple...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got a problem with that... ...then takes a ravenous bite and walks out of the room. INT.  NORMAN'S STUDY - DAY Norman finds Claire seated on his desk, her legs spread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take it your not mad at me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't go that far. She grabs his belt and pulls him into her, then holds the apple to his mouth.  Norman tentatively takes a bite.  She mashes it slowly into his mouth until he recoils slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mouth full) Okay... When he chews the huge bite, a glistening drop of juice runs down his chin.  Claire leans forward and licks it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's gotten into you? She just smiles mischievously, then starts kissing him.  It looks like she's eating his lips.  Norman's getting hot.  She bites down on a lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too rough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Since when? Something about this response frightens him.  Claire yanks Norman's belt open.  He steps back, tripping over his castered desk chair.  She's on top of him in a flash, sitting astride him.  She speaks in a forceful, sexy whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like this, this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pinning his hands above his head) Why don't you shut up and fuck me, Professor. She grinds up against him.  Suddenly, something pulls her eye to the hallway. POV - The COAT RACK MIRROR, now from inside the study.  In it's reflection:  ANOTHER CLAIRE, shorter hair, stunned expression.  Where she's standing...it's DAYTIME. Claire leans over him until they're nose-to-nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tense whisper) I think she's starting to suspect something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (through clenched teeth) Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaning down) Your wife...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Norman shoves her off of him onto the floor.  He stands, breathless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing?! In a moment, it's Claire again, stunned and trembling against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to herself, remembering) "You know..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rattled) What? She looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claire--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flooding back to her) I came to work in the garden and I saw you with her...in my house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I snuck back to my car, trying to convince myself it never happened.  And when I woke up in the hospital...somehow it hadn't.  Until now. He just stares at her, his face anguished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was last year.  We were having troubles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you fucked a student?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reaching for her) That's not what I'm sayi--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulling back)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: POSTERS FOR ALTERNATIVE AND METAL BANDS,

direction.raw_text: touch me.  Just get away from me. Go! He's frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Norman doesn't move.  He's never seen her like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine... She bolts toward the living room.  He follows her. INT.  LIVING ROOM - NIGHT She grabs her coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (welling up) Claire, please don't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you think I would do?  Jesus Christ!  I gave up my life and my music...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never asked you to quit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Oh BULLSHIT.  You had to topple perfect Daddy and that meant perfect wife, perfect family... He follows her as she searches for her purse and keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  You wanted to quit!  And then when you did, you hated me for it... so you gave it all to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Caitlin!! She wheels on him with fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave her out of this!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then out of nowhere, some bright young woman found me attractive...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...would do anything just to be around me.  And I slipped.  God help me, I slipped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to listen to this. Claire goes to leave, Norman blocks her path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tried to break it off!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have tried harder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (seething) Get out of my way. She brushes past him. INT.  FOYER - NIGHT He catches up, beside himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Claire's nearly disarmed by this rare emotional outburst. She turns at the door and looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You made it impossible for me to be someone you could be in love with. She leaves. INT.  LIVING ROOM - MORNING Norman, rumpled and unshaven, is passed out on the couch, a half empty whiskey bottle beside him on the coffee table.  He awakens to find Claire sitting across from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to answer one question. He waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you have anything to do with her disappearance? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Claire goes pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was damaged and unstable.  The more I tried to distance myself, the more desperate she became.  Finally, she showed up at the new house...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did she know where it was? He stares off.  The reality sinks in for Claire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Our dream house. Norman can hardly look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was out of control.  She said she was going to kill herself...or you.  I never thought she'd go through with any of it, but then she was gone... He trails off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know that for sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course she did, Norman.  What else could it be? The enormity of this hits Norman.  His head drops into his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, what have I done?  How could I have let this into our lives? He looks up at her, teary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She gets up and walks out of the room. EXT.  JODY'S STUDIO - DAY An old industrial loft filled with finished and half-finished oil paintings.  Jody brings Claire some tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and everything I have, everything I thought my life was...Christ when I think of all the lies... Jody looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (beat) Jody what? Jody looks up, tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God...you knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was down in Adamant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adamant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artsy little village down seven.  There's a guy there who sells my work.  I had just dropped off some paintings and as I got in my car...I saw Norman sitting at this little cafe. Claire waits for her to continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I started to walk over...but he wasn't alone.  A blond.  I only caught a glimpse. She was young. (beat) I should have said something right away. But I didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partly because I didn't want to hurt you...but partly...partly because I was relieved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relieved?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had just been left by Richard.  I was bitter and miserable and for some fucked up reason, it made me feel better that your life wasn't as perfect as it seemed. Claire nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time I finally got up the nerve to tell you, Stan called from the hospital and it was too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late?  Jody, it was an accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alone?  On a two lane road?  With a ton of Valium in your system? Claire walks over to a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got there first.  Stan covered up the pills and I had it out with Norman.  He seemed desperate not to lose you.  He promised to handle it.  And we all let it drop away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of us. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a terrible friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Claire turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could I expect you to tell me something that I wouldn't even tell myself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you going to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she was dangerous before--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She could have hurt me if she wanted to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know that. (beat) If it's your belief that gives her form, then you've got to shut her out.  Somehow you have to break the connection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  She wanted me to know the truth.  Now that I do...I think she's at peace. Jody isn't as sure. INT.  KITCHEN - DAY Claire walks in.  She notices the clock on the range is dark. She flips on a light.  Nothing happens.  Worried, she heads upstairs. INT.  NORMAN AND CLAIRE'S ROOM - MORNING Claire enters.  The bed is empty.  The shower is running in the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman? INT.  BATHROOM - MORNING ANGLE - CLAIRE...her face a mask of terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God... CLAIRE'S POV The BATHTUB, with the shower curtain drawn around it, the water blasting.  Norman's limp hand pokes through the curtain.  AN ELECTRIC CORD leads from the mirror socket into the tub. Claire races over and rips the plug from the wall.  She tears the SHOWER CURTAIN AWAY to find A BLUISH NORMAN lying, unconscious in the tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no.  Please no... She hugs her face to his chest until she picks up a heartbeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman!!  Wake up!  Please! Claire shakes him to no effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God...NORMAN! She slaps him on the face...once, then twice.  He suddenly sucks in a gulp of air, begins struggling and dazedly returns to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me...it's me... Sobbing, she shuts off the squeaky faucets and struggles to pull him upright.  She discovered HER BLOWDRYER in the tub and hurls it across the room. INT.  BEDROOM - DAY Claire sits beside Norman on the bed as two E.M.T.'s, an OLD GUY and a HEAVY WOMAN pack up.  Stan's on the phone, Jody off to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vitals are good.  I'd take it easy for a couple of days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. The E.M.T.'s leave as Stan hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll take you for a CAT scan tomorrow if you're feeling dizzy at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That won't be necessary. He glances at Claire as he walks Stan out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not unless there's a miracle drug for clumsiness. They leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jody, she tried to kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe this is happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need help.  Please let me call the medium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That could take days.  I need to do something now.  Don't you see?  She wants us dead. Jody thinks for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alight, alright.  Stay calm.  You opened this door.  There's got to be a way that you can close it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have an idea.  But, I mean, I'm just making this up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : MADISON'S SMILING FACE EXT.  DOCK - DAY Claire's staring down at the PRINTOUT.  She's kneeling at the edge of the dock.  From her pocket she produces THE BLOND BRAID and a piece of TWINE.  She wraps the braid up in the printout with a rock and secures it with the twine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.  Better or worse, he's mine. She tosses the little parcel into the dark water.  Bubbles stream up.  In the bubbles, Claire sees...THE PALE SHAPE, which slowly becomes THE DROWNED GIRL, staring up from beneath the dark water. Claire wants to pull away, but she's transfixed.  Madison reaches up toward the surface.  As the bubble diminish, she seems to be FADING AWAY.  When she's gone, Claire reaches out toward the water.  When her finger touches the surface... WHOOSH!  She's sucked down into the water. INT.  UPSTAIRS SITTING ROOM - DAY Norman glances out of the window in time to see a splash off the dock.  He races out of the room. EXT.  UNDERWATER - DAY Claire struggles furiously as the unseen attacker drags her deeper into the murky depths. EXT.  DOCK - DAY Norman sprints toward the dock. EXT.  UNDERWATER - DAY As he oxygen begins to run out, Claire screams desperately as her hand plunges into the muddy bottom. Suddenly, she's released.  She yanks her hand free, the silt swirls revealing...a COPPER COLORED GLINT in the mud. NORMAN'S HAND grasps Claire's ankle and pulls her upwards. EXT.  DOCK - DAY Norman helps Claire, coughing, onto the dock.  They hold each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay? She nods, catching her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you see, she's trying to kill us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can't be here without me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you be sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, but I am.  She was there and then she was gone.  I felt it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Claire... She stares into the still water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over. INT.  BEDROOM - NIGHT Claire in bed with a blanket wrapped around her.  Norman walks in with some steaming mulled cider.  He stokes the blazing fire.  He sits on the edge of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it's going to take awhile before things are back...until they're better than before.  But you've given us a chance to make a fresh start.  And I'm going to spend the rest of my life making you glad that you did. The gaze at each other.  Tentatively, she places a hand on his. EXT.  GARDEN - DAY Claire, dressed in a warm sweater, finishes wrapping her rosebushes for the winter.  She picks up a basket of clipped flowers and heads inside. EXT.  PORCH - DAY She turns the doorknob and listens for the whispering.  All is quiet. INT.  FOYER - DAY She looks into the mirror and sees only the study and the lake behind it. INT.  NORMAN'S STUDY - DAY Claire places the roses in a vase on Norman's desk, and in doing so, accidentally knocks it over. With a towel she mops up the water which has dripped onto the wooden floor.  The stream has flowed over to the knot and dripped into the crack.  Claire stares down at THE STRANGE COPPER COIN. She grabs a letter opener from Norman's desk and pries the coin out.  It's actually a SMALL BRASS KEY, the head of which is THREE INTERLOCKING CIRCLES.  She stares at it for a moment, then places it in her pocket. EXT.  SAILBOAT - DUSK Claire stands toward the bow watching the sunset.  The leaves on the surrounding hills are stunning.  Norman appears beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last sail of the year. She gazes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The leaves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible.  We should take a drive before they're gone.  Spend the night at some cozy little bed and breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look for antiques...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep.  There's some great places nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a reflex) Adamant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Little village down seven.  Supposed to be charming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we can stop there for lunch. He wraps an arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you'd like. She leans against him, staring out. EXT.  DRIVEWAY - DAY Jody and Claire return from a walk.  Norman has the boat on the trailer and is securing a tarp over it.  They stop under a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he acted like he'd never heard of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he say that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jody he was lying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if he was?  Do you think he wanted to bring that up again just when you're trying to make a new start?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's trying to put it behind him, Claire. You should too. Norman smiles and waves.  They wave back as they arrive at the Karman-Ghia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got a beautiful life.  And even with this, it's always been clear that he loves you. (beat) I've come to think that's all that really matters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, Claire.  You hear something... change the subject.  You find something... get rid of it, throw it in the lake. (beat) You know what happened.  The rest is only details.  And no one's ever glad they got a hold of those.  If you want to put this back together...just let it go. Jody drives off.  Claire walks over to Norman.  She hugs him tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm cooking you dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have to do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.  I'll do the shopping. They kiss.  She heads to the Volvo. INT.  VOLVO - DAY Claire is approaching a country market.  She spots a little sign with an arrow:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't really know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know what you mean. She ambles off across the street.  Claire watches her go. Then notices a sign hung out above a little shop.  THREE INTERLOCKED CIRCLES.  She walks toward it. EXT.  SHOP - DAY Claire stands in front of the store window.  A sign in the window identifies it as "The Sleeping Dog - Hand wrought jewelry and gifts."  Claire tries to open the door, but sees a closed sign. She steps back out to the window and looks in.  On display are a selection of handcrafted jewelry and curios. Suddenly her eye stops on a small silver bracelet with an intricate ROSEBUD. Her eye travels up and behind it to the back of the display where she spots, a small ORNATE COPPER CHEST.  Protruding from its lock...THE INTERLOCKED CIRCLES.  Claire looks like she's been punched. INT.  NORMAN AND CLAIRE'S ROOM - NIGHT Claire glances over at the soundly sleeping Norman.  She gingerly slides out of bed. INT.  BASEMENT - NIGHT Claire sits among the boxes, leafing through the photo album, tracking the years of their life.  Her hands tremble. Finally she reaches the picture of their wedding, reaches behind the photo and produces...THE KEY. EXT.  DOCK - NIGHT Claire in her nightgown and a jacket, walks slowly down the dock.  An expensive looking flashlight illuminates her path. She stops and stares out at the moonlit lake. She holds out a fist.  Her fingers unfold and in her palm lies THE KEY.  She holds the key out over the water and stands there, frozen.  The lighthouse beam sweeps past her once...then again. Claire pulls her hand back and holds the key to her chest, then carefully places it on the dock.  She very deliberately takes off her jacket and slippers, steps to the edge of the dock, shines the flashlight on the dark water...then steps off the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.  BEDROOM - NIGHT AN ANGUISHED CRY from downstairs.  Norman bolts upright in bed. INT.  NORMAN'S STUDY - NIGHT Norman walks through the darkened house into the moonlit room.  He pulls up short when he sees the strongbox sitting closed on his desk.  He looks around, sees the room is empty and walks over to it. The mud and silt has been wiped from the top, on which is engraved:  To N.C.S. with love always, M.E.F. He pulls open the lid and tentatively peers inside. THE LIGHTS SWITCH ON. Claire stands in the doorway, holding out the SILVER ROSEBUD NECKLACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking for this? Norman stares at her dumbly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's out there isn't she?  She's in the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  Don't...you don't understand what this is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't I, Norman?  YOU KEPT THE FUCKING NECKLACE.  Of a woman you killed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nearly hysterical) I did NOT!  I did not kill anyone.  Jesus. Claire, listen to me.  I walked in and she was lying there dead.  I swear to you.  On my life!  She took pills and she killed herself in our house to destroy me!  To destroy us!  If I hadn't stopped by here before school, the painters would have--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  That's...you have to believe me!  Oh God, I'm telling you the truth! (beat, fighting tears) I did what I had to, Claire.  She was gone.  There was nothing I could do for her.  I did...I put her in the lake.  I rolled the car in...and I watched it sink. (beat) And I've lived with that image ever since. (beat) I couldn't just stand there while everything-- my career, us, everything, just washed away.  Don't you see, Claire?  She's doing this!  This is exactly what she wants you to think! Claire's lip is quivering with confusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what's true anymore. (beat) But that girl must be brought up.  Now do you want to call the police?  Or should I? Norman stares at the phone.  He's a wreck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine.  I can't live with it anymore. He takes the phone, punches in three numbers, waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Dr. Norman Spencer.  No, it's not an emergency. He looks at Claire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have some information about a missing girl, Madison Frank...Yes.  Could you send an officer?  Fifteen Willoughby, about a mile before the bridge...Thank you. He hangs up.  Long silence.  They look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did the right thing. (beat) I'm going to get cleaned up. He walks out.  Claire walks over and stands before the box. INT.  BEDROOM - NIGHT Claire walks into the bedroom.  The shower can be heard through the bathroom door, which is partially ajar.  Steam drifts out through the crack. She stands in her dressing room and catches sight of her weary, distraught countenance in the mirror.  She glances down. CLAIRE'S POV The necklace still in her hand. She looks up again into the mirror.  Her face goes strangely blank and, almost mechanically, she clasps the necklace onto her neck. Suddenly, she stares over at the CORDLESS PHONE lying on the bed for a long moment.  She walks over, picks up the phone and looks at it. CLAIRE'S POV The redial button. She stares at the bathroom door, then hits the button.  Two rings, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on phone) Directory assistance... Claire's eyes widen in terror.  She clicks off the phone, and, taking it with her, starts moving toward the door to the hall.  She keeps a steady eye trained on the bathroom.  She quietly pulls open the hallway door. Suddenly, A HAND WITH A WASHCLOTH IS THRUST OVER HER FACE. Claire shoves Norman's hand away and runs past him down the hall. INT.  HALLWAY - NIGHT She's nearly at the top of the stairs when her body starts to falter.  She tumbles over, dropping the phone, which clatters down the stairs before her. Claire is pulling herself down the stairs, moaning in terror. Norman can be seen calmly following her, waiting for the Halothane to take its full effect.  Finally, she freezes. Norman picks up the phone and stands over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, how did we come to this? He picks her gently up in his arms and starts carrying her slowly up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ghost stuff, that was impressive. CLAIRE'S POV Ceiling, shapes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figure you saw her that day in the house and just gradually intuited the whole damn thing.  That would be pretty astonishing.  A passive-aggressive masterpiece. INT.  BATHROOM - NIGHT And into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wasn't until the shower that I realized you actually believed it.  Nearly froze to death waiting for you.  Thought the circuit breaker would kick back over and I'd be toast. ...then she's lowered into the tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crazy thing is...I have never for one moment stopped loving you. He actually wipes a tear from his eye.  He kisses her lips. We can feel her revulsion.  His face over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry about Caitlin.  I'm sure in some tragic way this'll bring us closer together. He turns on the faucets, then moves out of her line of vision.  Sound of a number being dialed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's Norman.  Listen, we had a huge blowout, so I'm going down to sleep at the lab.  I guess you're out, but... maybe...if you wouldn't mind stopping by to check on her in the morning? She glances down and sees on the edge of the tub...a prescription bottle of VALIUM with her name on the label. Her eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just...Jody, it's bad.  I've never seen her like this... (he trails off, choking up) I don't really know what to do anymore. Norman, lit periodically by the sweep of the light house beacon, squats with the phone and gazes down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anything ever happened to her, I'd... (beat) Anyway, thanks. Claire, mute, glances frantically around.  One of her fingers begins to flutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tearfully) I'm so sorry. The tub is rapidly filling.  He checks his watch, then reaches for the Valium.  As much from will as the drug beginning to fade, Claire lets out a garbled cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sloppy, guttural) Mmmuh...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhhh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (slurry) Mauduh... Norman stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Norman seems unnerved that she's still clinging to her belief in the ghost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a little much, don't you think? He sees the necklace on her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oops.  Can't have that. He puts down the bottle of Valium, then reaches around Claire's neck to remove the necklace.  When his hands close on the clasp, his face suddenly goes slack. NORMAN'S POV His arms around MADISON'S BEAUTIFUL CORPSE. Norman explodes backwards, slamming his head into the BRASS SHOWER NOZZLE.  He staggers out of the bathroom before collapsing with a thud.  The water finally rises above Claire's nostrils. Claire somehow manages to work a toe into the plug chain and yank it free.  The water slowly descends. When it seems that her lungs must burst, her mouth finally clears the descending water.  She chokes in great gulps of air. The drug is finally wearing off.  Claire sits up.  Norman's unconscious feet can be seen outside of the doorway.  She turns off the water and stands unsteadily. She looks around for the phone and finally spots the little antenna protruding from under Norman.  She delicately pulls the phone out of his back pocket, only to discover that it's been broken by his fall.  She drops it and walks quietly out of the room. INT.  STAIRWAY - NIGHT Claire stumbles as fast as she can down the stairs. INT.  FOYER - NIGHT She fumbles for some KEYS in a basket by the door, then looks at the cell phone's recharging cradle.  It's empty. She spots Norman's coat hanging on the coat rack and rifles through the pockets.  She finds the phone, and flips it open to see if it's working.  A drop of something splats on the phone.  Then another.  It's blood. She looks up and sees Norman, his forehead gashed, glaring down from the landing. She reaches for the door knob, but the keys and cell phone in her hand make it difficult to open.  Norman hurls himself over the banister.  THUD! A BLOODY HAND yanks her backwards.  Claire slams into the corner by the armoir.  Norman advances on her.  At the last moment, she throws her shoulder into the armoir which tumbles over on Norman. EXT.  DRIVEWAY - NIGHT Claire races over to the Volvo, which is blocked by NORMAN'S PICKUP, the dark hulk of THE SAILBOAT on a trailer behind it. She starts to get into the pickup, then remembers to look in the bed...nobody there. INT.  PICKUP - NIGHT The truck is cold and doesn't want to turn over.  She stares at the door for signs of Norman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on...come on... ...and VROOM, the truck roars to life.  Claire spews gravel as she barrels the cumbersome rig out of the driveway, constantly watching the door. When she veers to the right out of the driveway, she looks into the rear view mirror.  The boat momentarily blocks the open door, then clears.  Still nothing. EXT.  DIRT ROAD - NIGHT Claire wheels the truck and trailer out onto a two-lane road. INT.  PICKUP - NIGHT Shivering with cold and adrenalin, she tries to work the ancient heater.  She turns onto THE BRIDGE. EXT.  BRIDGE - NIGHT The PICKUP and BOAT race across the deserted bridge. INT.  PICKUP - NIGHT ANGLE Claire through the windshield.  Her face striped by the reflection of the bridge lights which whip one-by-one across the windshield.  She flips open the cell phone and punches in 911.  It blinks:  "NO SERVICE."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. She glances into the rear view mirror. CLAIRE'S POV A stern section of the boat's COVERING TARP untied, flapping in the breeze. Claire desperately punches the "talk" button again..."NO SERVICE."  She's past the center of the bridge.  She looks again:  "ROAM."  Claire punches the talk button again. SMASH! A TRAILER CRANK punches through the window.  Norman's arm follows, coiling like a python around Claire's neck, his grim visage pressed against the glass. She squashes down the accelerator. EXT.  BRIDGE - NIGHT The trailer starts to weave from side to side, swerving the pickup.  Claire chokes, then blacks out. EXT.  BRIDGE - NIGHT The Pickup and trailer smash through the railing, barreling over bumpy terrain straight toward the BOAT RAMP. The truck hits the water at fifty and Norman is hurtled through the rear window and into the passenger side dashboard. INT.  PICKUP - MOMENTS LATER Claire is unconscious in the driver's seat, a trickle of blood runs from her nose.  Norman stirs briefly as Claire groggily comes to.  She hears the hissing of the smashed radiator, then sees Norman, a shattered bloody mess on the floor of the cab. She leans over to see if he's dead, hears a squeak and realizes that the pickup, with the BATTERED SAILBOAT AND TRAILER miraculously still attached, is rolling deeper into the water. Before she can get the door open, the truck is half submerged.  She frantically manages to lower her window halfway and starts to pull herself out. Her ribs have just cleared the glass when a bloody fist locks onto her ankle and yanks her inside.  Norman pulls her down until they're face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Norman...NO... She yanks the emergency brake, but it's too late...the submerged wheels lock and slide slowly down the mossy ramp. The truck is nearly submerged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (desperately) Norman, please... The water is up to the windows.  Norman shakes his head slowly as he blinks away blood from his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think of Caitlin... Water sprays in through the hole in the rear window and momentarily blinds Norman.  Claire jerks free and scrambles out of the driver's side window as the truck sinks. Just as she's free of the window, she jerks to a stop.  She looks down and sees Norman, half out of the window, one hand clamped onto her ankle. There is a wrenching metallic creak.  The truck lurches downward...then silence.  IT DOESN'T SINK.  The boat buoys it like a fishing cork as it drifts out into the lake. The headlights pierce the darkness of the steep underwater drop off.  Claire tries to swim free, but Norman's not letting go. Suddenly metal snaps and the truck pops free of the trailer. It hurtles downwards and the still-glowing headlights reveal... MADISON'S SUBMERGED MUSTANG SMASH! When the front of the pickup lands on the hood of the car, the Mustang's windshield shatters.  A PALE SHAPE FLOATS UPWARD. Norman is suddenly entangled by something.  He tries to brush it free but comes face-to-face with MADISON'S GHASTLY, DECOMPOSED FACE.  The last of his air bellows out of him in a scream as he releases Claire's ankle. His dead staring face separates from Madison's as the truck slowly tilts back and sinks to the bottom. EXT.  LAKE - DAWN Claire breaks the surface with a huge intake of air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : UNDERWATER - DAWN The sound of a furious cello solo. COLD STARING EYES Norman, half out of the truck, arms floating. Follow his eyes to THE PALE CORPSE, drifting above, tethered to the Mustang by an old seat belt around her ankle. Move through the murky water toward the corpse's clothed back.  As she twists into view... MORPHS INTO:  MADISON'S PALE BEAUTIFUL FACE...at peace. Camera drifts, moves upward and breaks the surface as the distant lights of EMERGENCY VEHICLES approach. CUT TO: FINGERS ...filled with moist earth.  A hand tosses the clump of dirt onto... EXT.  CEMETERY - DAY A CASKET Widen to reveal Claire, dressed in black, stepping away from the grave.  A tiny arm snakes around her waist.  She glances down to see Caitlin, her eyes shining, clasping her mother tightly.  Claire takes a last look into the grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest in peace. THE GRAVESTONE - MADISON ELIZABETH FRANK Mother and daughter turn and step back.  Next to them, also in black, is MRS. FRANK.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: mi. She hesitates for a moment, then take the turn. EXT.  ADAMANT - DAY Claire stands on a street in the quaint little village.  She looks around, spots a little cafe with outdoor tables.  A friendly old HIPPIE WOMAN walks out of a store.  She watches Claire gazing around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: A HAND WITH A WASHCLOTH IS THRUST OVER HER FACE
